intro: Sida tomentella, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida tomentella is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
